intro: Brachystelma cupulatum, commonly known as the red-tipped moon cactus, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. Brachystelma cupulatum is well adapted to arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
